name: An

Rating, 5 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Let's start with the pros:
- check-in is quick, clear, according to the instructions issued
- the apartment is very spacious, bright and bright
- in general, there is all amenities for a comfortable stay
- nice bed
- great internet
- a cursed kitchen
- good location - you can walk (Capitol, restaurants, churches)
- Free parking close to the house
I would recommend this apartment if you are in Boise.
Of course, there are disadvantages, of course.
Since the house is not new, respectively, there may be problems with the wiring, as we had when we decided to turn on the microwave and kettle at the same time. Then it cut off some of the outlets and nothing helped. I had to use my extension cord.
But plus, the host was in touch and tried to resolve the issue. I hope so did.
Another disadvantage: since the house is at a rather busy track, be prepared for the fact that an ambulance or a police machine can pass by. This is rather a disadvantage for those with sensitive sleep.

name: Travis
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Unique space that met my needs for my 1 person trip. I left each day by 9:30am and returned midnight or later. Conveniently close (3-4 blocks, <10 min walk) to a local hotel where I was attending a multi day seminar.
Full kitchen was useful, especially the blender to make morning smoothies. I couldn’t get the Keurig to work though, so no coffee every morning.
Bathroom was clean but needs updating. Ceiling tiles were stained and shower was so small that the shower curtain sticking to me when I turned.
Bed was warm and comfortable but sagged in the middle. No bedroom closet to hang clothes.
Living room was spacious and had a nice large tv. Couch and recliner were comfortable. Dining table in the living room served well as my work desk every night and morning. Good lighting.
Front door was drafty, gaps around door, loud noise from very busy State Street.
Host was responsive and helpful. No flexibility though when I requested a late (additional 90 min) checkout.

name: Travis
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
November 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The location is great, walking distance do the downtown area, lots of good restaurants nearby. The house was definitely old. It was clean, but there were a number of things that were in poor condition, ceiling areas with water damage, holes in walls, covered by tape and manila folder, missing outlet etc. There were also electrical problems. Some of the outlets would trip, and it was difficult to tell which GFI to reset. We stayed in Nov, and it was cold in the house, they did provide two ceramic heaters, but overall it felt drafty. Hot water for showers also was a little iffy. So overall my experience was meh. I probably won't stay there again. The house has a lot of potential though, with some repair and remodeling, it could be a really fun spot in a great location.

review_text:
Aaron and Kelly's place is in a great location to get to everything in downtown and Hyde Park. I was able to walk everywhere I needed to be while in Boise. The apartment was very clean and all pertinent information was provided. Watch the video they send!
2 potentially minor things, the roads are pretty busy and therefore a little loud in the apartment. Luckily it was quiet at night. Secondly, the shower is very small! I'm a relatively thin 6'2'' and while it totally worked, but was a bit cramped.
Overall, this place is exactly as described and my stay was good. Thank you!

review_text: This is a great location for those who walk or take public transportation. Apartment reminds me of one that I or friends would have rented in college. It is roomy for two people, spotless, and has all kitchen amenities. Because it is on a main street, there is some traffic noise. Parking is on street, sometimes a block away , depending on hours. Coffee shops, grocery stores, gas, pubs, bars, and restaurants are all in walking distance. Hyde Park, a must see, is blocks away.

·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I’m giving a five star review, which I think is justified. The house is comfortable and well-appointed, with a great location just steps from the University. A couple negatives… the immediate neighbor’s house is a bit of a dump with multiple boats and cars cluttering the yard. The rental house itself is very comfortable and has been thoughtfully updated, but there are creaking floorboards that make it tough if one bedroom wakes up before another. The walls are also somewhat thin between this place and the adjoining apartment. The neighbors were reasonably quiet and respectful, but I could practically eavesdrop on their conversation as I was drifting off to sleep. All that said, I’m still giving a 5 star review because the place is as advertised with a great location and good value for the money.

Stayed one night
review_text:
This was a really great stay. For not being a large place I found it very comfortable and it excelled in a few areas.
It was easy to get to and the restaurants that I grabbed carry out from were all about five mins away. With the restaurants, and two grocery stores, I don’t think I ever needed to go anywhere that was more than seven minutes from the house.
The provided water was also the best water I’ve had in years. And I have a great filter on my faucet at home.
The shower products are really great and the shampoo was some of the best I’ve used in a very long time as well.
The hosts were friendly and responsive.
The house was quiet at all hours.
I would definitely repeat this stay.

Even though we didn't need much, my husband was like, look at this, and this and this -- everything from a clothes steamer to feminine products. I especially appreciated the selection of charging cords on each nightstand. They have anticipated the needs of any guest. We will definitely stay again. Thanks Cory and Kat!

Great neighborhood. Great town. Thank you!

Everything about Phil and Dana's cottage in Hyde Park is top notch! The pictures don't lie, the cottage is immaculate, light-filled, and beyond charming. Everything was clean, the bed and linens were comfy and the kitchen was very well stocked. Check the freezer before you buy your own coffee, there is quite a selection there from previous guests, including us :)
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay; walking to the Co-op, restaurants, coffee houses, the park and the beautiful neighborhood daily. We made some friends just by enjoying the sun on the porch swing. Everyone was so friendly and there's plenty of foot traffic to chit-chat with. The cottage is only a couple of blocks from Hyde Park, and despite the foot-traffic to downtown the area is very quiet, even in the evenings.
Thank you Phil and Dana for the most perfect stay in your beautiful town!

The hosts were responsive about possibly get someone out to look at it, luckily after 8am the water pressure came back up (likely after sprinkler system shut off). Unfortunately this made us miss our breakfast we had planned with others we were in town with and a frantic start to the morning. I inquired about a refund or partial due to the inconvenience but have not received a response a day later. Unfortunate

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We absolutely loved our stay at the Hyde Park Hideaway and would stay here again in a heartbeat when we return to Boise. The location is perfect to be able to explore all of Boise, and there is of course plenty to do right nearby in Hyde Park.
Let me just say the included bikes are a huge perk. We biked everywhere, from Downtown to Outlaw Field for a concert to a hike just outside the city. The greenway is incredibly convenient as well for getting around. I wouldn't do Boise without a bike and having them included was great!
The home was just as described, very comfortable, clean and had all the necessities. We worked from the house for a couple days during the week before exploring on the weekend. The internet speeds were as advertised and we never had an issue.
If you're thinking about visiting Boise either for work or fun... stay here! You couldn't find a better home base.

Although we didn’t cook in the kitchen this trip it would be great for preparing meals- lots of counter space and room to move. Bathroom is very tiny! Neighborhood is surprisingly quiet considering the close proximity to 13th Street with lots of patrons parking near the house. Would book again and recommend to friends and family.

rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
June 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Enjoyed my stay! My only complaints, and they are minor, are about accuracy of the listing. Once I arrived in this cute neighborhood with its great location relative to downtown, I expected to have parking. The listing stated both ‘on premises parking’, and also referred to ‘on street parking’. There was no parking for me other than searching for a spot on the street. I brought this to their attention, and they did not have much to say to excuse it away. I found various spots on the street during my stay, none more than a block or so away, but usually on the same street. Ok. The second item, was they had a toaster listed under the amenities. When asked, they quickly replied back, and said there was none. They did drop one by in time for the next morning, which was appreciated. So that is it! I value accuracy, and knowing I can count on what I’m told is there, what is included, and not included. One star less for (in)accuracy. I’d suggest they correct those parts of the listing that aren’t so. It was a fine stay otherwise, well appointed kitchen, little things like seasonings and olive oil for cooking, toiletries there if I needed, laundry pods and the like. Suited me and my needs great for my stay. Thank you!

They even decided to work one night. Needless to say, it wasn’t quiet at all. The hosts were very understanding and even refunded us some money. Not their fault other than the fact that they could have given us a heads up on the construction, it started in May and was going to go through June. As long as there is no construction, this would be a great place to stay.

review_text:
My sister and 3 adult sons spent 5 nights and we were blown away by Kirstin, the house/Patio and being a block from the Greenbelt! You could explore the Greenbelt for a month straight and still not see everything. We took our dog to 'Dog Island' at Ann Williams Park and saw so much wild life (Turtles, frogs, raptors, ducks) We went biking at sunrise, kayaking and fishing at sunset. It is very easy to get kayaks to the pond across the bridge. Fantastic restaurants on the river just a couple of blocks away.
The house!! It was outstanding in every way. It exudes a cozy, modern vibe with many gathering spaces that can pull any group together for meaningful moments. We cooked a lot in the kitchen (has everything) and BBQ'd every night. The lights on the patio were stunning. The beds! Best nights sleep ever. There are so many other things I could say! We are all still talking about what an amazing time we had. This will be always be our first choice for Boise

It was a little on the colder side while we were there so we didn't get to enjoy the kayaks in the garage BUT....if it had been warmer you are just steps away from a chain of lakes to enjoy them on. Lots of green space and places to go on foot.
The place was so comfortable too. We had 4 people there and plenty of space. The kitchen was about one of the most stocked places I've been to. Lots of spices, essentials for cooking and all the pots and pans you could ask for. It really felt like home. I would definitely come back and stay again.

rating_info:

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We like to go out and explore during the day but have a comfortable place to lounge in the evening. This house was perfect for that! It is only a block from the Greenbelt, which takes you all the way to downtown through trees, parks, and some commercial/restaurant areas. There were also a surprising number of fun eating and drinking spots within a 15 minute walk.
The house itself was exactly as pictured. There were a couple of comfortable seating areas inside, as well as a fabulous patio with fireplace in the front of the house. The master bedroom had a super comfy memory foam mattress and pillows for a good night's sleep after a long hike or walking all over town. We also really enjoyed the double sinks and spacious bathrooms.
We were bummed that the provided bikes had multiple flat tires, which forced us to change some of our plans. Kirsten was responsive and did her best to resolve the issues quickly, but there's only so much she could do since she doesn't have a stash of extra bikes like a rental shop would. The bikes are a nice benefit, but maybe just don't count on them if you're like us and don't have the know-how to do basic repairs if needed.

My wife and I would absolutely recommend this wonderful home to anyone visiting Boise. The Owner, Kirsten communicates extremely well. The home is warm, well kept, and very comfortable. I cannot say enough about the location, and I highly recommend using the bikes provided by the Owner to take a stroll down the green belt…absolutely the highlight of our weekend. 5 stars each for (1) Owner, (2) Cleanliness, (3) location, (4) Amenities, and (5) Comfort. If it’s available…book it, you will thank me (and Kirsten) later.👍

Communication with Kirsten during the check in and out process was so easy and I really appreciated the use of the garage. She thought of everything—from the bikes and kayaks in the garage to the coffee, creamer, and sweetener to start of my morning. She is deserving of that super-host designation! Definitely would stay here again.

The rooms are large, bedding very comfortable and cleans. Beds are amazing. Don’t be afraid of the Murphy bed. It’s so comfortable.

Very safe area. Super close to the water. Loved using the bikes and kayaks. They even have towels for the beach so I didn’t need to pack mine.
Very relaxing weekend getaway will be coming back for sure!

We easily put the 2 kayaks on the trolley, pulled them to the other side of the river and paddled in the lakes. Each night, we sat out on the patio to relax. Luciano's, right next to the river, was excellent. Push & Pour Coffee Shop is within walking distance; yummy coffee and pastries. Kirsten made sure we were able to self-check-in ok, which I thought was a nice. She is a quick communicator! We didn't bring our dog but the little welcome set-up and the doggie doors were nice additions. The patio area is 100% fenced.

We're local (had to get out of the house during renovations), so we knew where it was, but we didn't realize how much fun it was going to be! Kirsten provides bikes and kayaks, so you can just hop on the Greenbelt or into the Whitewater Park. A good-sized front yard and patio with a firepit, table and chairs, and a gas grill make it a relaxing vacation spot. The kitchen is well equipped; the 2 bedrooms and bathrooms upstairs are large and comfortable. Be aware that, as of this writing, there is a lot of construction on the block, so street parking is affected. Regardless, we highly recommend this house - we'd stay again if the need arose!

I would happily pass up a stay at our typical hotel chain to stay here again...much more quiet and roomy, but as hospitable as our "platinum" status. Kirsten will definitely make you feel welcomed and at home. She is paying attention to details that make an Airbnb stay worth it.

The bartender wanted to come out and pet our dogs!
The information booklet of our hosts was extremely helpful. Our hosts also very thoughtfully left us a bottle of wine! This was after two nights of no dinner, so we were delighted to see the wine! Also, the bedding was extremely beautiful amd comfortable which makes a big difference when you have been on the road for several long days! We could not have had a better stay. Thank you, thank you!

review_text: My family stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday and the house was great! It was perfect for us to have a place to hang out together. SUPER CLEAN. The house was spotless. The kitchen was well stocked with everything I needed to make our holiday meal. Tons of pots and pans, dishes etc. The beds were super comfortable and had great bedding and pillows. Most people skimp on this part but not here. The upstairs movie room was great at night for all of us to hang out in and watch TV. They had extra blankets and pillows so it made it super relaxing. I loved that the bathrooms were already stocked with shampoo/conditioner/body wash so didn't have to worry about bringing those with us. The towels were nice and soft. The house being pet friendly was a huge perk. My Son was able to bring over their small dog for the day while we were cooking etc and would go in and out of the doggy door. She even played with the super sweet doggy next door. If you are looking for a nice quiet relaxing home this is it. Very nice!

review_text: We stayed one night at Samantha's Place while in town for a wedding and her house accommodated our family wonderfully. Plenty of space in the living room for playing games together. Both bathrooms were spacious, and the fresh eggs in the fridge was a nice bonus and made for a great late-night snack! Samantha was friendly and accommodated our change of time for check-in. It's near the freeway and convenient to downtown Boise. One minor thing--bring your own shampoo and soap. We don't stay in Air BnBs often and we didn't think of bringing our own--thought they'd be provided like a hotel. No big deal at all though--I'm sure if I contacted Samantha about it when we were there she might have had some toiletries on hand for us to use. Her house in really peaceful and on a beautiful small country farm lot.

The guest house is also situated on a wonderful piece of property where we could let our pup roam freely or play with her dogs. We enjoyed the mini farm atmosphere of chickens and cows, with the occasional hawk fly by. The fresh eggs from the chickens spoiled us immediately to store bought.
Samantha is an amazing host who is friendly, fun to have conversation with and has great recommendations.
We are already missing our home away from home and look forward to our next visit.

review_text: Samantha’s guest house is amazing. It’s truly a hidden gem…conveniently located within a few miles of the airport, city center, and all the hustle and bustle of the city…yet you find yourself in a super quiet, rural neighborhood of farmland and sprawling acreage. Sam’s guest house is completely remodeled, filled with all modern conveniences and technologies, striking artwork and furnishings, and super comfortable bedding. There are free range chickens on the property (with farm fresh eggs provided for breakfast!), and adorable goats next door. Sam’s 2 dogs are super friendly and greeted my small shih-tzu with slobbery kisses and wagging tails. I’ll definitely return to this lovely property whenever I’m in Boise.

The only one partial con of the place is that the downstairs and upstairs are occupied and you can hear them easily. But besides that I highly recommend this property.

Stayed with kids
review_text: My family and I had great time staying at this location. It was nice being right next door to the Franklin House, they have a beer garden directly next door! We didn’t realize upon booking that this house had three levels that were rented out. We were under the impression that we booked a single level home, but that was on us for not reading the description closely enough. Although we weren’t expecting others sharing the space with us we were able to make friends with the full time attendant below and fellow Airbnb renters above. The location and our portion of the house were perfect for what we needed. If this house was a single level home with no neighbors it would have been a 10/10 but all things considered the house was still everything we needed and more. We were just a little more weary of any noise we would make, having two kids, which made the overall experience a little more stressful than we were expecting. We apologized for any excessive noise but our neighbors didn’t notice

Kurt and Heather were terrific hosts. They sent us detailed instructions ahead of time, and let us know when everything was ready before we checked in on the day of arrival. They were happy to answer any questions too.
The setting is rural, has a nice farm-feeling, and was peaceful. Our hosts made this unit very welcoming and comfortable. It's a place you can just kick back and relax. Everything was clean and tidy with plenty of natural light. Some of the lights are a bit bright for us, but some softer bulbs or dimmer switches might be a nice adjustment. The bathroom is a generous size, with the walk-in closet. We enjoyed the fresh eggs from their chickens and baked banana bread and butter in the fridge....a very nice personal touch. We would definitely recommend staying at Kurt & Heather's and would visit again if we are in the area.

review_text:
This was the perfect stay for our trip & exceeded all our needs, both in lodging & communications w/ the hosts. The property is exactly as described, and there's additional information listed in the unit upon check-in.
The kitchen is perfect, really functional, and met all our needs. There is no oven/stove, but a hot plate is provided, and there are plenty of extras, most notably the fresh eggs & baked banana bread😉. So good! Thank you!
The bed has multiple pillows, some of which are softer, and others are more firm, which was great because it met both of our needs for comfort, and there are plenty of extra blankets, towels, and storage space.
The one, and only issue we had is the main street is a bit dark, so sometimes you have to really look out for the driveway, but GPS really solves that issue. Otherwise, the neighborhood is nice & quiet, the stay was perfect & we would absolutely come back!
ps. The chickens are very cute

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2024
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
When we identified this property on Airbnb, it seemed to match our needs in terms of location, size, cost, etc. But if anything, we found the property to be even better than it looked on Airbnb!
The space is over a three-car garage (but we never heard garage doors, cars etc.), with an outside staircase (careful - steep!) for private entry. The place is cozy yet spacious, a comfortable one-bedroom apartment with excellent king sized bed. Two TVs. Nice bath, with a 2nd toilet available in the cozy laundry/closet room (small washer/dryer for clothes).
The combined kitchen / dining / living room had a very spacious feel. Dishes, pots and pans were nice and met our needs. It is a perfect place for two - but easily could house a few more (like a family with a few small children).
We didn't have much contact with the hosts, but when we did (in person or texting) they were friendly and immediately responsive. When we return to Boise, we very much hope to be able to stay here again!

name: Aimee
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This was a great place to stay. Clean & exactly as described with thoughtful touches. The location is convenient, minutes away from the village. The kitchen was well stocked for anyone needing to cook. Fragrant lilac trees on the way in were a welcomed surprise! I’d happily stay here again, but will note the following for help to both the host and guest:
The apartment is located on top of a garage and connects to the main house. The door that connects to the main house lets through noise from the kitchen area down there, so I was able to hear kids crying, playing, and pots and pans banging around over the weekend. Garage door as well. This didn’t really bother me, but I think it could bother someone, so worth noting.
I made a pizza in the toaster oven one evening. While nothing was burning, the smoke alarm in the main house was set off. There was nothing I could do about it as I couldn’t access the main house, but it’s worth considering some additional ventilation for the future.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Samantha is an excellent host and was very attentive and responsive during our stay. We were gone for a function and were away from guest house most of the weekend, but during the time we were there the keypad battery at the front door got low and Samantha was quick and brought extra batteries for the keypad. She answered our questions of where an item might be located and she answered questions for us and is kind and wanted to make us aware that she was always available if we neeeed anything. The guest house was clean, free of clutter, comfortable, private, quiet, and peaceful. We loved the booklet of recommendations for outings, restaurants, life in Boise, other useful information for guests. 100% recommend a stay here, and will certainly be back ourselves if we ever visit Boise again!
